Connecting with Students

When you study a psychology course at Liverpool Hope University you become a member of the Department of Psychology. An important aspect of our community is connecting with students, and throughout your course you have the chance to get involved in different events and activities, and shape the learning experience. This website provides details about the ways in which students work with academic tutors, how feedback is used to enhance the psychology courses, and opportunities for tutors and students to get involved in the community.

Student VoiceWhat is the Student Voice Committee?

The Student Voice Committee in the Department of Psychology is a committee made up of academic tutors and students from Psychology and we work together to ensure the psychology courses are meeting the needs and expectations of our students and colleagues

Listening and learning from the student voice allows the department and student bodies to receive and analyse up-to-date student feedback. This feedback helps to keep us informed of the needs of the students, which in turn allows us to improve, refine and make educated decisions toward all departmental processes.

We consider all the things that are going well on the courses, and we also look at possible improvements. The University relies on feedback from students to make sure that it is providing the best quality of education. In the Department of Psychology, we are very keen to ensure the student voice is heard! A Student Rep's role is to be the ‘voice’ for your group
Information on this page provides the names of your student representatives, and outlines the feedback provided to us, and how we have responded to that feedback to enhance the student experience.

Student Voice Committee Members

You said.... we did

Connecting with students is very important to the Department of Psychology. There are several opportunities for you to provide feedback on the teaching and learning in Psychology at Liverpool Hope University. The tutors take your feedback seriously, whether that be formal feedback via the course evaluations at the end of the year, feedback from Student Representatives via the Student Voice Committee, or informal feedback in lectures, seminars, and tutorials. At the start of the new academic year, we outlined how we are using this feedback for the 2023-24 academic year. Here are some things that you told us at the Student Voice Committee, and how we have responded.

Jump to.... Level C | Level I | Level H | Level M
Archives.... Level C | Level I | Level H

Responding to Level C Student feedback

Level C Core 1 Nov 2023/24

Core 1 Research Design & Analysis (RDA)

‘We feel uncertain about the in class test’

Simon and Jamie already had a revision lecture scheduled to help prepare for the test, but based on this feedback they created and released a mock test and tutors covered this in the final seminar before the test.

Level C Core 1 Nov 2023/24

Core 1 Research Design & Analysis (RDA)

‘The recommended textbook for RDA is not very user-friendly’

A second recommended text has been added to the RDA reading list and Simon will provide suggested reading from this new text as well as the original text.

Level C Core 1 Nov 2023/24

General - Student Rep Emails

'Reps asked if it was possible to have a Student Representative email address for each year group so that students could get in touch easily'

Glen has approached IT to facilitate this and is awaiting a response. In the meantime, the Reps have been advised to set up a single account for their level which they can all access using gmail.

Responding to Level I Student feedback

Level I Core 1 Mar 2024

Guest Speakers

'Students enjoy talks from guest speakers'

This is great to hears, and we have more planned. However we are exploring reasons for low turnout to guest talks

Level I Core 1 Mar 2024

Participating in SONA studies

‘Some students find it difficult to access SONA and participate in studies.’

Access issues have now been resolved and Level I students can participate in SONA studies

Level I Core 1 Mar 2024

RDA 2

‘Peer evaluation sheets would be helpful in RDA 2.’

We are discussing the inclusion of peer assessments in RDA2 with the tutors

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

RDA 2 - Praise

'Students...

  • ..think that the walk-through videos in RDA are very useful
  • ..are enjoying the structure of RDA
  • ..think worksheets for the RDA in the class are very helpful'

We love hearing positive feedback like this, and it is great that you are enjoying RDA2 because we know it can be a challenging part of the course for many!

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

Vision & Cognition - Praise

'Students...

  • ..find that the exam questions are very helpful
  • ..appreciate staff support

This feedback is great to hear. The introduction of example exam questions is new this year, so it is good to know they are helpful.

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

General - Lecture Recording

'It would be really useful for learning, catching up, and revision if we had lecture recordings for all lectures'

We know that some lecture recordings are available, but unfortunately not all. We have taken this issue to the Director of Student Learning at the University, and this is now being raised with IT.

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

RDA 2

'The Chapel is not suitable as a lecture theatre'

We agree that the Chapel is not ideal as a lecture theatre. Dan has arranged for a room change and the RDA2 lectures will now be delivered in Eden130.

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

General - SONA Credits

'We have been confused about SONA credits'

We are happy to clarify that Level I students do not have a course requirement to collect SONA credits in this academic year. You can, however, still take part in research studies, and we would encourage this.

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

General - Exams

'We are not sure how to answer exam questions'

We understand that some students feel anxious about exams, but if you keep an eye on your course structure on Moodle, you will see that revision sessions are already built into the lecture schedule.

Level I Core 1 Nov 2023/24

General - Assessments

'Can you send us reminders about assessments being due?'

The deadlines are all on Moodle and we would encourage you to make use of Google Calendar to remind you of assignment deadlines, and to help map out your time and build in rest breaks and fun!
Glen has offered to run a support session to help you develop skills with Google Calendar if there is enough interest from students. Please respond using this form to indicate if this is a session that you would like to attend.

Responding to Level H Student feedback

Level H Core 2 Mar 2024

Advertising Dissertation Studies

‘Advertising studies on platforms other than SONA, i.e. a webpage, would increase the number of participants studies can attract.’

This is an interesting suggestion, and we are exploring the ethical and IT implications around this.

Level H Core 2 Mar 2024

General Comments

‘Lots of lectures are scheduled with a one-hour break between them.’

Level H Core 2 Future Challenges lectures have been changed from two 1-hour lectures to one 2-hour lecture.
For 2024 we are working with Timetabling to explore different lecture schedules

Level H Core 2 Nov 2023/24

General - Praise

'Students said...

  • ...they like RDA 3
  • ...they think the assessment grid on Moodle is good'

It's wonderful to hear praise for the course, so we thank you for these lovely comments.

Level H Core 2 Nov 2023/24

General - Engagement

'Students said...

  • ...they are interested in taking part in a mentoring scheme'

It's fantastic that you would like to be mentors for other students. The Level H Reps are currently working to implement a peer mentoring scheme to be in place before the end of the academic year.

Level H Core 2 Nov 2023/24

RDA 3

'Why can't the groups be split into qual/quant groups?'

The RDA3 workshops are designed to further develop a range of research skills (in addition to supporting the Dissertation). This aligns with the requirement from the BPS that students cover a range of topics at each level of a psychology degree. To provide Dissertation support for specific study designs, Glen will be running some optional Qualtrics and PsychoPy sessions after the Christmas break. Complete the form to express an interest and outline your level of confidence in these skills

Level H Core 2 Nov 2023/24

Biological Psychology

'We find it awkward to clap to respond to questions'

Every lecturer has their own style and methods to help students to engage with the topic area, however we have removed the need for clapping.

Level H Core 2 Nov 2023/24

Careers Session

'some of us missed the session due to a clash'

We apologise for the clash. Luckily our Careers Advisor, Ali Wood, offered to run the session again and it was great to see several students attending this second session.

Responding to Level M Student feedback

Level M March 2024

MSc Conversion Statistics

‘Students would like to use R rather than Jamovi and have some workshops in this’

Great to hear the enthusiasm for R and we are planning an Introductory Workshop for students with no prior experience of statistics.

Level M March 2024

Applied Developmental

‘Students are happy and feel they are benefiting from the experience within their placement organisations.’

It's wonderful to hear such positive feedback about your placement experiences.

News & EventsWhat's going on in Psychology?

Student Funded Trip Last week the department funded eleven students to attend a Neuroscience of creativity talk held at Camp and Furnace. The talk was delivered by Dr Pinar Oztop a lecturer in Early Childhood studies at Liverpool Hope Univerisity. Read a review of the talk, written by a current Level I student, Rebecca Harrison
13/12/23 - Research Seminar Join us for our last session before the holidays, for an insightful talk by Professor Mary Steen Chair of the Mother’s Babies and Families Research, Professor of Nursing, Midwifery and Health at the University of Northumbria, and Visiting Professor at University of South Australia. Professor Steen will explore her research on "Cultivating Compassion: Being kind to yourself and others." Further details available here
05/12/23 - 12 Tasks of Christmas Student Futures are offering the chance to wine Amazon Vouchers each week in the run up to Christmas. All information available here
08/11/23 - At the end of October, Professor Neil Ferguson travelled to Texas Christian University (TCU) in Fort Worth, TX for the Association of Moral Education’s 49 th Annual Conference. The AME provide an international forum for the interdisciplinary study of the moral and ethical dimensions of human development and education, while this year’s conference primarily focused on positive youth development. Read more about the importance of Neil's Texan trip here
22/11/23 - Research Seminar Psychology Research Seminar - Wednesday 22nd November, 2pm, SSA007. Professor James McAuley, Honorary Research Fellow in Political Psychology at Liverpool Hope, will deliver his seminar entitled Recalling the Future: Collective memory, narratives and re-writing the past in Northern Ireland
03/11/23 - Studentship Success Dr Laura Helyer will be undertaking a staff-led doctoral studentship, to conduct research on the morality of school disciplinary practices and policies. For more information about this exciting new project click here
27/10/23 - ICYMI For those who missed Dr. Senna's fascinating research talk on Wednesday 25/10/23 or wish to access the content, it is now accessible on the Departmental Moodle. You can find it under "Research Information" in the "Research Seminars" section or by downloading a PDF version of the presentation here.
18/10/23 - Plas Caerdeon Psychology staff members took to the hills with 30+ Psychology students to visit Plas Caerdeon, Hope's outdoor activity centre near Barmouth in Wales. Activities included kayaking, slate mine walking, zip wire and mountain biking to name just a few of the opportunities on offer.
25/10/23 We are excited to announce our first departmental research seminar, starting next week on the 25th of October at 2pm in room SSA007. Dr. Irene Senna will be presenting her research on "Recovering from Blindness: Learning to see after sight restoration from congenital cataracts."
28/08/23 - Psychology @ Global Hope During the summer Psychology staff and students travelled to Brazil on a Global Hope project to support the work and development of Ramacrisna Arts Co-operative. Read Dr Jamie Lingwood's blog post about the trip here
28/08/23 - Student Blog Global Hope Josie, a combined honours student of Music and Psychology joined staff and other students on a recent trip to Brazil. Josie documented their experience in a blog which you can access here.If you would like to know more about opportunities to volunteer with Global Hope you can read all about it on the website

Voicesfrom around the department

Beata
Level C Student

I really enjoyed the trip to Plas Caerdeon. I think that I really got to know more people doing my course and made some new friends. The food was lovely and the staff there made the activities fun, and treated us like adults, as I was afraid we would be seen as children. I enjoyed the mountain walk, but I wish we had more time to do more stuff.

Glen
Lab Manager &
Professional Tutor

I volunteered to support students at Plas Caerdeon this year as it is such a great place to visit. The team who work there are so dedicated and thoroughly enjoy their jobs, and this shows in their enthusiam for working with the students who visit. I was delighted that so many of you came along this year, as the larger the group size, the more activities we can try!

Hannah
Level H Student

Completing a research internship over the summer has helped me improve my research skills by working alongside a well established researcher. This developed my confidence and knowledge that I am applying to my dissertation. I feel that it has given me an advantage and opened up opportunities to build a career in Psychology. I would highly recommend this opportunity to any students at Hope!

Liam
Psychology Administrator

On Wednesday, we had Irene's talk on learning to see after blindess. As someone who has no background in the sciences, never mind Psychology, it was a really interesting experience to sit and listen to Irene deliver a talk on the vital research she has undertaken

Get to know...
Prof Nick Donnelly

Nick joined Liverpool Hope in September 2019 bringing an impressive body of research in essential aspects of visual cognition. These interests include understanding the psychological processes involved in searching for visual targets, including man-made threats and basic processes in face perception. Click this link to read "Just another face in the crowd"

Student Rep
Caroline Knowles

Caroline says..."I am here to have an open conversation with you, my peers, to raise important issues to the department and to give feedback. This will help the course to continuously evolve and improve all through the ideas of those who have gone through it."

PsychSoc
President Chelsea Jones

Chelsea says..."Hi my name is Chelsea. I am 20 and from Wolverhampton (up the Wolves!). I study Criminology and Psychology. I aim to create a community for the psychology students at Hope as there are so many of us. I also aim to create a welcoming environment to ensure everyone feels comfortable and there is access to peer to peer support. Of course I also want the Society to put on events, social nights, themed nights out, movie nights, study nights and general get togethers. I’m looking forward to getting to know you all."
